Interface BankInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
Bank
public interface BankInterface
A interface specifying the required methods for the Bank class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    loadAccounts(String accountFile)
    Loads bank accounts from the specified account file.
    void
    processTransactions(String transactionFile)
    This method opens the specified transaction file and applies the transactions to the accounts in the array list.

    Saves the bank accounts in the array list to the specified text account file.

  • Method Details

    • loadAccounts

      void loadAccounts(String accountFile) throws FileNotFoundException
      Loads bank accounts from the specified account file. The account file is a text file with one line per account. Each line consists of an integer account number and a double balance, separated by a tab character. This method reads the accounts and adds them to the array list of accounts.
      Parameters:
      accountFile - name of the file containing the account information
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist

    • saveAccounts

      void saveAccounts(String accountFile) throws FileNotFoundException
      Saves the bank accounts in the array list to the specified text account file. Accounts should be saved in the text file one per line. Each line consists of an integer account number and a double balance, separated by a tab character.
      Parameters:
      accountFile - name of the file where the accounts should be saved
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist

    • processTransactions

      void processTransactions(String transactionFile) throws FileNotFoundException
      This method opens the specified transaction file and applies the transactions to the accounts in the array list. The transaction file is a text file with one transaction per line. Each line starts with the name of a transaction type (CREATE, DELETE, DEPOSIT, WITHDRAW, or TRANSFER), followed by additional information appropriate for the type of transaction. The details of the for each type of transaction are as follows: The CREATE transaction is followed by an account number and an initial balance. The specified account is created and added to the array list. The DELETE transaction is followed by just an account number. The specified account is removed from the array list. The DEPOSIT transaction is followed by an account number and an amount to deposit. The specified amount is deposited to the specified account. The WITHDRAW transaction is followed by an account number and an amount to withdraw. The specified amount is withdrawn from the specified account. The TRANSFER transaction is followed by a "from" account number, a "to" account number, and a transfer amount. The specified amount is transferred from the "from" account to the "to" account.
      Parameters:
      transactionFile - The text file containing the transactions
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist
